Package managementserver

Class ManagementServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • managementserver.ManagementServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IManagementServer, ISubject<ITree<IProduct>>, ISubjectManagementServer, IListener<IProduct>, IWarehouseListener
    public class ManagementServer
extends Object
implements IManagementServer, IWarehouseListener, ISubjectManagementServer
    Implementation of a management server facility. The implementation is given using the Singleton pattern and thus only one instance of the management server can exist during runtime.

    It holds a local copy of the IProduct assortment given in a IWarehouse. The assortment is organized in an ITree parametrized with IProduct.

    It provides an implementation for the IManagementServer interface. This interface specifies the behavior concerning the assortment of IProducts that are managed by the server (add, remove...). Furthermore, it provides methods to handle associated ICashRegisters.

    In addition, it implements the IWarehouseListener interface. This interface allows the management server to be notified about changes about the IProduct assortment (possibly from the Warehouse).

    The ISubjectManagementServer interface is implemented as well. It provides methods for IObservers so that they can register and unregister as well as retrieve the IProduct assortment.

    Author:
    OOP

    • Method Detail

      • GET_INSTANCE

        public static IManagementServer GET_INSTANCE()
        Returns an instance of the IManagementServer. To be more precise, it returns the only instance of the IManagementServer since this is a singleton.

        If no instance is available yet, a new instance is created. In this case the assortment of the ManagementServer has to be initialized as well.The assortment ITree of IProducts is initialized as follows:

        The root node is a CategoryTreeNode with the value Products. Immediate children of the root ITreeNode are ProductCategoryTreeNode that correspond to the values defined in the ProductCategory enum.

        This means that after the initialization the ITree looks like this:
        CategoryTreeNode:Products
        ---- ProductCategoryTreeNode:Food
        ---- ProductCategoryTreeNode:Beverage
        ---- ProductCategoryTreeNode:Default

        Hint: You may want to use a private initialize method for this.

        Returns:
        the instance of the IManagementServer

      • addCashRegister

        public void addCashRegister​(ICashRegister cashRegister)
        Description copied from interface: IManagementServer
        Adds the passed ICashRegister to the management server. If the ICashRegister also implements the IObserver interface then it is also registered as an observer. In this case the ICashRegister is immediately notified about the current IProduct assortment via IObserver.notifyChange(ISubjectManagementServer).
        Specified by:
        addCashRegister in interface IManagementServer
        Parameters:
        cashRegister - The ICashRegister that should be added.

      • unregisterCashRegister

        public void unregisterCashRegister​(ICashRegister cashRegister)
                            throws NotRegisteredException
        Description copied from interface: IManagementServer
        Removes the passed cash register from the management server. If the cash register is also registered as an IObserver, the notifications are deactivated (see IObserver.deactivateNotifications(ISubjectManagementServer) and it is removed from the observers.
        Specified by:
        unregisterCashRegister in interface IManagementServer
        Parameters:
        cashRegister - the ICashRegister that should be removed
        Throws:
        NotRegisteredException - This exception is thrown if the passed ICashRegister is not registered at the IManagementServer

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange​(IProduct object)
        This method is called if changes in the IProduct assortment should be performed. The IProduct that has been changed is passed along as an argument. If the passed IProduct is managed in the local ITree assortment (an ITreeNode with an equal IProduct exists), then the underlying IProduct of the corresponding ITreeNode is updated.

        If the IProduct matches more than one ITreeNode all of them should be updated.

        If an ITreeNode with an IProduct matches the passed IProduct, but their categories are different, then the ITreeNode should be deleted and the IProduct should be added as a new ITreeNode in the corresponding ProductCategoryTreeNode. However, only ITreeNodes that are immediate children of a CategoryTreeNode should be deleted. This is because an IProduct may be included in other ITreeNodes as they are part of a CompositeProduct. In this case they are not changed.

        If the passed IProduct is an instance of a CompositeProduct it has to be checked, whether a new child has been added to the CompositeProduct. For example, if a IProduct has been added to the CompositeProduct then this new child IProduct is missing as a ITreeNode in the ITree. Thus, all immediate children of the CompositeProduct have to be compared to the children of the corresponding ITreeNode. If a child in the CompositeProduct does not have a corresponding child ITreeNode in the ITreeNode it has to be added as new child ITreeNode. Removed children of the passed CompositeProduct may be ignored and don't have to be deleted in the ITree.

        Hint: Use fitting ISearchFilters for the ISearchableByFilter.searchByFilter(ISearchFilter, Object) function to find the corresponding ITreeNodes. In addition make use of the ITreeNode.findNodeByNode(ITreeNode) and ITreeNode.findNodeByValue(Object) methods.

        Hint: You may implement private methods.

        Specified by:
        notifyChange in interface IListener<IProduct>
        Specified by:
        notifyChange in interface IWarehouseListener
        Parameters:
        object - The object that has been changed

      • productAdded

        public void productAdded​(IProduct product)
        Notifies the listener about an IProduct that has been added to the Warehouse.

        The passed IProduct should be added to the ITree assortment according to its ProductCategory. So, for example, if the ProductCategory of the passed IProduct is ProductCategory.FOOD then it should be added to the ProductCategoryTreeNode with category ProductCategory.FOOD. The ProductCategoryTreeNodes are immediate childs of the root ITreeNode.

        If no ProductCategory can be identified, then the ProductCategory.DEFAULT category should be used (the ProductCategoryTreeNode with this category}.

        Specified by:
        productAdded in interface IWarehouseListener
        Parameters:
        product - The IProduct to be added

      • productRemoved

        public void productRemoved​(IProduct product)
        The listener is notified that a IProduct has been removed from the Warehouse.

        The corresponding ITreeNode of the passed IProduct should be removed from the ITree assortment. If an ITreeNode is removed also all its children are removed.

        Hint: All matching ITreeNodes have to be removed. This may lead to an mismatch with the Warehouse (this can be ignored).

        Specified by:
        productRemoved in interface IWarehouseListener
        Parameters:
        product - The IProduct to be added

      • getChanges

        public ITree<IProduct> getChanges()
        Retrieves a copy of the ITree IProduct assortment.
        Specified by:
        getChanges in interface ISubject<ITree<IProduct>>
        Returns:
        the ITree of the IProduct assortment

      • register

        public boolean register​(IObserver obs)
        Registers an IObserver in the ISubject.

        Notifications are activated on the IObserver using the IObserver.activateNotifications(ISubjectManagementServer) method. The IObserver is immediately notified about the IProduct assortment (via IObserver.notifyChange(ISubjectManagementServer)).

        If the IObserver is already contained in the ManagementServer nothing is performed.

        Specified by:
        register in interface ISubject<ITree<IProduct>>
        Parameters:
        obs - the IObserver that should be registered
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the passed argument is not NULL and not already registered. Otherwise FALSE.

      • unregister

        public boolean unregister​(IObserver obs)
        Description copied from interface: ISubject
        Unregisters the IObserver in the ISubject. In this case notifications are disabled (via the method IObserver.deactivateNotifications(ISubjectManagementServer)).
        Specified by:
        unregister in interface ISubject<ITree<IProduct>>
        Parameters:
        obs - the IObserver that should be unregistered
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the passed argument is not NULL and registered at the ISubject. Otherwise FALSE.

      • propagateProducts

        public void propagateProducts()
        Description copied from interface: IManagementServer
        Notifies all IObservers about a change in the IProduct assortment via IObserver.notifyChange(ISubjectManagementServer).
        Specified by:
        propagateProducts in interface IManagementServer

      • retrieveProductSortiment

        public ITree<IProduct> retrieveProductSortiment()
        Retrieves a copy of the ITree IProduct assortment. This method should only be called if the assortment is to be retrieved from a class that is not an IObserver.

        Returns the current IProduct assortment from the IManagementServer. This method is a fall-back in case the IProduct assortment has to be retrieved from a class that is not an IObserver.

        Note: If the object implements the IObserver interface this method should not be used. The method ISubject.getChanges() should be used instead.

        Specified by:
        retrieveProductSortiment in interface IManagementServer
        Returns:
        the ITree of the IProduct assortment

      • retrieveRegisteredCashRegister

                                             throws NotRegisteredException
        Description copied from interface: IManagementServer
        Returns the ICashRegister where the id matches the id of the passed ICashRegister.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
